newsitem.title: USA: Sybase reports profit, names Kertzman chairman.
newsitem.headline: Sybase reports profit, names Kertzman chairman.

text.p: - Sybase Inc reported a weaker-than-expected profit for the second quarter, before the launch of a slew of new database software in the second half of the year.

Sybase, based in Emeryville, California, also said Mitchell Kertzman, the current chief executive officer, was also named chairman of the board. Kertzman replaced Mark Hoffman, who resigned earlier this month.
Sybase said it had second-quarter profit of $4.4 million, or $0.06 cents a share, compared with a loss of $24.6 million, or $0.33 cents, in the same quarter a year ago.
Wall Street expected Sybase to earn $0.07 a share, according to a recent survey by Zacks Investment Research. Second-quarter revenue fell 4.9 percent to $237.6 million from $249.9 million a year ago.

Sybase writes database software, the programs that store massive amounts of vital information in corporate computer networks. The company has a slate of new products in the works for introduction in the second half of the year, when revenue is expected to pick up.
